definition: old horse sniffs the wind (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
hiss/neigh/Ss! (sound of air sucked between the teeth, indicating hesitation or thinking over)
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
lit. the old horse loves his stable/fig. sb old but reluctant to relinquish their post (idiom)
sacrificing one's life generously (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
a show of strength
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
sage Emperors Shun and Yao rule every day (idiom); all for the best in the best of all possible worlds
jade garden of celestial ruler/paradise
old age/eighties, nineties, or greater (of age)
recess
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
(literary) wailing/choking with sobs
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
youthful age
totally exhausted as result of overexertion (idiom)
lit. kicking up the dust and breaking the harness/fig. to ride like the wind (idiom)
prostitute
lit. a chicken and a bottle of wine (idiom); fig. ready to make an offering to the deceased, or to entertain guests
